intro: Alnus fruticosa subsp. kamtschatica, commonly known as the Siberian alder, is a shrub-like species native to the cold regions of Eastern Asia. It is characterized by its small, simple leaves and catkin-like flowers, which are typical of the Betulaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and in mountainous areas. It has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, making it valuable for soil enrichment. Its hardy nature allows it to thrive in harsh climates, contributing to ecological stability in its habitat.
